statements: SELECT * FROM researcher_data
SELECT name, research_field FROM researcher_data WHERE age > 30
SELECT id, name, age FROM researcher_data ORDER BY age DESC
SELECT AVG(data_value) FROM researcher_data
SELECT name, research_field FROM researcher_data WHERE research_field = 'Biology'
SELECT * FROM researcher_data WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY name DESC, id ASC LIMIT 5
SELECT id, name, data_value FROM researcher_data WHERE data_value < 100 ORDER BY data_value ASC
SELECT research_field, AVG(data_value) AS avg_value FROM researcher_data GROUP BY research_field
SELECT id, name, age, research_field FROM researcher_data WHERE name LIKE '%John%' OR name LIKE '%Alice%'
SELECT * FROM researcher_data WHERE age BETWEEN 25 AND 35 ORDER BY age DESC, id ASC
SELECT * FROM outliers;
SELECT id, data_value FROM outliers WHERE id = 1;
SELECT * FROM investigations ORDER BY investigation_id DESC;
SELECT id, data_value FROM outliers WHERE data_value > 100 ORDER BY data_value ASC;
SELECT * FROM investigations WHERE reason LIKE '%data%' ORDER BY investigation_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM outliers WHERE data_value > 100 ORDER BY data_value DESC;
SELECT outliers.id, data_value, reason FROM outliers JOIN investigations ON outliers.id = investigations.outlier_id WHERE investigations.reason = 'Outlier Detected';
SELECT COUNT(*) as total_outliers FROM outliers;
SELECT SUM(data_value) as total_data_value FROM outliers WHERE data_value < 50;
SELECT outlier_id, COUNT(*) as total_investigations FROM investigations GROUP BY outlier_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT * FROM Outliers WHERE id = 1;
SELECT data_value FROM Outliers WHERE data_value > 100;
SELECT * FROM Researchers WHERE researcher_name LIKE 'John%';
SELECT investigation_id, outlier_id, researcher_id FROM Investigations WHERE outlier_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM Investigations ORDER BY investigation_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM Outliers WHERE data_value > 100 ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT researcher_name, data_value FROM Researchers JOIN Outliers ON Researchers.researcher_id = Outliers.id;
SELECT investigator_id, data_value FROM Investigations JOIN Outliers ON Investigations.outlier_id = Outliers.id ORDER BY data_value ASC;
SELECT Outliers.id, Researchers.researcher_name FROM Outliers JOIN Researchers ON Outliers.id = Researchers.researcher_id WHERE Outliers.data_value < 50;
SELECT * FROM Outliers WHERE id IN (SELECT outlier_id FROM Investigations) AND data_value BETWEEN 50 AND 100;
SELECT * FROM Researchers;
SELECT dataset_name, dataset_description FROM Datasets WHERE dataset_id > 100;
SELECT investigation_id, investigation_result FROM Investigations WHERE investigation_result IS NOT NULL ORDER BY investigation_id DESC;
SELECT outlier_type, value FROM Outliers WHERE outlier_type = 'high';
SELECT researcher_name FROM Researchers WHERE researcher_email LIKE '%@example.com%';
SELECT * FROM Researchers WHERE researcher_name = 'John Doe';
SELECT dataset_name, dataset_description FROM Datasets WHERE dataset_id > 100 ORDER BY dataset_name DESC;

SELECT researchers.researcher_name, datasets.dataset_name FROM Researchers AS researchers JOIN Investigations ON researchers.researcher_id = Investigations.researcher_id JOIN Outliers ON Investigations.outlier_id = Outliers.outlier_id JOIN Datasets AS datasets ON Outliers.dataset_id = datasets.dataset_id WHERE investigators.investigation_result LIKE '%suspicious%';

SELECT researcher_name, COUNT(investigation_id) AS num_investigations FROM Researchers JOIN Investigations ON Researchers.researcher_id = Investigations.researcher_id GROUP BY researcher_name HAVING num_investigations > 5 ORDER BY num_investigations DESC;

SELECT dataset_name, MAX(value) AS max_outlier_value FROM Datasets JOIN Outliers ON Datasets.dataset_id = Outliers.dataset_id GROUP BY dataset_name HAVING max_outlier_value > 100 ORDER BY max_outlier_value DESC;
SELECT * FROM Researchers;
SELECT researcher_name, research_field FROM Researchers ORDER BY researcher_name DESC;
SELECT dataset_name, data_value FROM Datasets JOIN DataPoints ON Datasets.dataset_id = DataPoints.dataset_id WHERE data_value > 100 ORDER BY data_value ASC;
SELECT researcher_name, action_performed FROM Researchers JOIN AnalysisLogs ON Researchers.researcher_id = AnalysisLogs.researcher_id WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT outlier_reason FROM Outliers WHERE outlier_id IN (SELECT outlier_id FROM DataPoints WHERE data_value < 0);
SELECT * FROM Researchers;
SELECT researcher_name, research_field FROM Researchers ORDER BY researcher_name ASC;
SELECT dataset_name, researcher_id FROM Datasets WHERE dataset_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT researcher_id, COUNT(*) AS total_datasets FROM Datasets GROUP BY researcher_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT DataPoints.data_point_id, data_value, outlier_reason FROM DataPoints JOIN Outliers ON DataPoints.data_point_id = Outliers.data_point_id;
